item.title: FLAIRR-TS -- Forecasting LLM-Agents with Iterative Refinement and Retrieval for Time Series
item.description: arXiv:2508.19279v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Time series Forecasting with large languagemodels (LLMs) requires bridging numericalpatterns and natural language. Effective fore-casting on LLM often relies on extensive pre-processing and fine-tuning.Recent studiesshow that a frozen LLM can rival sp...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompt, arxiv, model, experiment, template | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>

item.title: Quantized but Deceptive? A Multi-Dimensional Truthfulness Evaluation of Quantized LLMs
item.description: arXiv:2508.19432v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Quantization enables efficient deployment of large language models (LLMs) in resource-constrained environments by significantly reducing memory and computation costs. While quantized LLMs often maintain performance on perplexity and zero-shot tasks, t...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompt, arxiv, reasoning, large language model, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: POT: Inducing Overthinking in LLMs via Black-Box Iterative Optimization
item.description: arXiv:2508.19277v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Recent advances in Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting have substantially enhanced the reasoning capabilities of large language models (LLMs), enabling sophisticated problem-solving through explicit multi-step reasoning traces. However, these enhanced re...<br><br><small><strong>Source:</strong> arXiv | <strong>Keywords:</strong> prompt, arxiv, reasoning, large language model, model | <strong>Relevance:</strong> 100%</small>
item.author: noreply@contextengineering.news (arXiv)

item.title: Context-Engineering - "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy. A frontier, first-principles handbook inspired by Karpathy and 3Blue1Brown for moving beyond prompt engineering to the wider discipline of context design, orchestration, and optimization.
item.description: "Context engineering is the delicate art and science of filling the context window with just the right information for the next step." — Andrej Karpathy.
